node.text:
A podcast critically analysing the difference between the two terms 'faith' and 'religion', and how this distinction can help aid our relationship with God. These are some themes researched within my studies this year, which I really enjoyed and so thought to share :) 

‚ÄúùòêùòØùòµùò¶ùò≠ùò≠ùò¶ùò§ùòµ ùò∏ùò™ùò≠ùò≠ ùòµùò¢ùò¨ùò¶ ùò∫ùò∞ùò∂ ùòµùò∞ ùòèùò™ùò¥ ùò•ùò∞ùò∞ùò≥ ‚Äî ùò£ùò∂ùòµ ùò™ùòß ùò∫ùò∞ùò∂ ùò∏ùò™ùò¥ùò© ùòµùò∞ ùò¶ùòØùòµùò¶ùò≥, ùò¥ùò∂ùò£ùòÆùò™ùòµ ùò∫ùò∞ùò∂ùò≥ ùò©ùò¶ùò¢ùò≥ùòµ ùòµùò∞ ùòßùò¢ùò™ùòµùò© ùò™ùòØ ùòèùò™ùò¥ ùòÆùò¶ùò≥ùò§ùò∫."

It's the last Thursday night of this beautiful month... the perfect opportunity to reflect upon the lessons we'll be taking forward with us to cultivate our faith journeys. Eltemase dua üåπüåô 

*The Imam Ali (a) hadith is in the comment section below.

node.text:
‚Ä¢
she is a mighty warrior,
she is a sweet, luminescent flower,
she is the rose 
at the shaft of the sword, 
she is the daughter 
of the lion of her lord. 

// a poem in dedication to the three holiest of women, who were the epitomised examples of beautiful humanity and soul, and resultantly the complete backbone of Islam. without whom there would be no Islam. this is undoubtedly my most heartfelt poem, produced and played for the ‚ÄúShe Inspires Me‚Äù event by @wihlondon today, where all proceeds were donated to @mkactcharity. thank you for your kind invite and the opportunity, i apologise i could not be there in person, may God bless all your sincere efforts. üåπ

may we be of generations whose greatest inspirations are only the Holiest of Ladies. may we cherish the meaning of piety from their universities of knowledge. may we honour the sanctity of our souls in their footsteps. for we are eternal souls confined within bodies, not mere bodies owning transient souls ‚Äî and herein lies the truth. ‚Äúthere is no one who can ever inspire me in the way that you do.‚Äù
ùòöùò©ùò¶ ùòêùòØùò¥ùò±ùò™ùò≥ùò¶ùò¥ ùòîùò¶.

dedicated to all those suffering, silently, overtly, inside or out ‚Äî may Their (s) precious hands be on your head and protect you. ‚ù§Ô∏è

with love and duas,
Saarah

node.title: She Inspires Me - Khadijah, Fatima, Zainab.

node.text:
i kneel 
as i see 
the sea before me, 
yet i close my eyes

for the seas of Your love
anchored in my heart
are far greater than even 
the seven seas of this world 

the water gives life to the earth
yet You poured light upon my dust 
and told me, 

‚Äúfree yourself My beloved! 
be free in the Light of My Love, 

though I created this all in your service 
do not get fixated on My signs! 
I created your heart not for them,
I created it only, so there, 
I may reside ùó†ùòÜùòÄùó≤ùóπùó≥ 

you may look across My universes,
but you will not see a sea 
that buries treasures 
as precious as this 

so when you see the sea, 
honouring My Majesty 
with the eyes I gifted you ‚Äî 
know it is I calling upon you, 
whispering through the breeze, 

come back to Me, 
My beloved.‚Äù 

‚ù§Ô∏è
#blessedfriday 
#jummahmubarak

node.text:
‚Ä¢
on nights like this ‚Äî in the city of Kufah, orphans reside in the hollow darkness, with not a soul to enquire of their well-being. on a night where the head of the manifestation of Justice and Mercy is severed in two, like the blood-moon split and cleaved, i ask who could know grief more than those who were orphaned from His love? enemies and foes spoke of His bravery, the citizens of His state of His generosity, but who knew His heart like the abandoned left to pale in the peripheries, towards whom He turned His tender-loving gaze, granted the warmth of His embrace, those gifted intimacy with the face of the Divine Names? 

those who had none other than You. 

poets, scholars, sages hail You, they cannot be You. warriors praise You, but testify they are not You. yet for those deprived of You, by the pangs of distant ages... ya Ali, there is none but You. there is only one You - He who in all His greatness regards Himself only as ‚Äúthe Servant from the Servants of our Master Muhammad [s].‚Äù - yet He who our Master Muhammad [s] testifies is His own and beloved Soul. 

on the nights that belong to the orphans disarrayed, the heart pains as we pray to remain followers of The Straight Way, so that the orphans of Aale Muhammad [s] whom we commemorate did not suffer in vain. 

who is there for us, after You, ya Ali? üíî

- 
production: @albatoolfoundation @sunbehindcloud

node.text:
seraph ‚Ä¢ ser¬∑aph ‚Ä¢

an angelic being; an angel of the highest rank, associated with light, ardour, and purity. üíõ

‚Ä¢

how much i miss these beautiful faces, who without a single hesitation, sacrifice all in the love of service. how much i often felt i owed them, for welcoming us and making our visitation as ethereal as it was. for the purity of their smiles, the kindness in their hearts, the generosity of their souls. how contagious their kindness is, away from our worlds of constricting materialism - a kindness only understood by the fact that they are the servants of the king whose generosity can never be known; if even by the notions of infinity. the king from the household of generosity. is there a love in this world more beautiful than yours, ya Husayn (a)? whoever gives, swears by your love, indeed they only ever receive more. the hearts and souls rejoice in the perpetual banquet of giving and receiving in your Name, where blessings never seize. who are you ya Aba Abdillah (a)? whoever comes to know of you, falls in love with you, over and over again. ‚ù§Ô∏è

-
Info; 
This poem is from üìñ: Arbaeen: a Lens into a Sacred Journey [link in bio] photobook üì∑: @ali_a_85 
üñä: @saarah.fb thank you for these videos: @karbala12_

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Saarah Bokhari on August 10, 2022. May be an image of book, tree, outdoors and text that says 'soul to soul Saarah Bokhari'.

node.text:
I am grateful to announce the release of my second book. ‚ÄòSoul to Soul‚Äô is a collection of poetic soul musings reflecting upon the journey of life towards the Divine. This book is written towards a universal audience, through the faith lens of the Islamic worldview on spiritual striving. It is in dedication to Imam Sajjad ‚Äî for many reasons. Dedicated to him, because his supplications always inspired me to write from a young age. To him - who beautifies souls through his writings. Therefore, I have chosen to announce it today on the day he becomes an Imam. The details of the book will therefore be released leading up to 25th Muharram, whereby there‚Äôll be an official launch date inclusive of all relevant information. 

We know the greatest war in Islam is against oneself. We know Karbala‚Äôs saints were heroic for the way they first conquered their own souls with obedience to God. We know Imam Sajjad survived this, and wrote His pure heart into the eloquent supplications we cherish today. So one year, besides His presence in Medina, I was inspired and determined to complete this book regarding managing the soul‚Äôs experience of life, pain, joy, suffering. Ultimately, to reclaim one‚Äôs divinity through the process of life. 

The very first draft of this book was complete five years ago, in 2017. I was so passionate for the concept, that I wrote and wrote, all in the span of a day. But since that one day, I changed, evolved, grew, and my writing did too. I could never quite finish it ‚Äî until very recently it all fell into place, and it met its completion. 

Soul to Soul is intendedly written to be intimate with the soul of the reader. It is written in order to be a mirror, between us and ourselves. And above all, a mirror to our relationship with the divine. It is written to inspire the reader to look within the chambers of their own soul. To celebrate His praise. To comfort you when you fall. To offer seeds of reflection. To find some feelings of hope and centralisation, if life begins to feel bleak. Soul to Soul, is from my soul to yours. 

With love and requesting your prayers at this new milestone,

Saarah Bokhari.

peace be upon the one, for whom the heavens and the earth weep. and peace be upon the heart of the Messenger on the day He said soil would turn blood red for the martyrdom of Hussain. and peace be upon the household of Nabuwah, slaughtered thirsty on the desert plains. And peace be upon the Master of the Age, and the blistering pain of His heart today. peace be upon the eternity that flows through our veins on this day. ya Hussain. üíî

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Saarah Bokhari on August 06, 2022. May be an image of text that says 'WATER You gifted life in the form of water to the same hands who would sever it from you. for you are the rose of Ali and Fatima he who gave his fragrance even to the hands who crushed it'.

node.text:
ùòûùò©ùò¶ùòØ ùòàùò≠ùò≠ùò¢ùò© ùò§ùò≥ùò¶ùò¢ùòµùò¶ùò• ùò∏ùò¢ùòµùò¶ùò≥, ùòèùò¶ ùò≥ùò¶ùòÆùò¶ùòÆùò£ùò¶ùò≥ùò¶ùò• ùò†ùò∞ùò∂ùò≥ ùòµùò©ùò™ùò≥ùò¥ùòµ. 

The household of generosity were known to gift water to strangers who passed by. In the desert heat, water is a gift for the thirsty ones seeking shelter. They would run out of their homes and offer it in service. The metaphorical irony does not evade us, given how these were the very personalities who poured the water of life on a society that was an arid desert prior to Islam. It was through their sacrifices that Islam became known, cultivated and flourished. 

7th Muharram, 61 AH. The water is cut off from Aale Muhammad, an act that makes the slaughter of the innocents in Karbala the most cruel of acts. As Imam Sajjad (as) would say, they butchered my father worse than how you would butcher a thirsty sheep. An ummah who severs water in a scorching desert, from the same ones who taught them the meaning of life. Water is life, as Imam Sadiq (as) says. Metaphorically the irony does not evade us ‚Äî it was the act of the greatest ingratitude to God, for the gift of spiritual life. 

Here are some poems from the Arbaeen book for Imam Hussain ‚Äî around the theme of water. The irony is, master, water is a perfect metaphor used to describe your endless generosity. Yet water is the very right of life from which you were deprived. There were so many clauses God placed on that day. Say, politically they wished to kill Imam Hussain (as) ‚Äî but what about making the Prophet‚Äôs family refugees? What about the children who were killed? What about the water that was deprived? What about the women who were abused? Karbala screams of the innocence of life, and the sheer corruption of religion on the other. So many human rights were deprived on that day ‚Äî a sure truth, that an Islam without basic humanity is no Islam at all. Humanity did what it did, but Creation bows to you, Master. You are the Water of Life, which is why your ship sails freely, limitlessly and eternally across the oceanic waves of this world. üñ§

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Saarah Bokhari on August 06, 2022. May be an image of text that says 'WATER You gifted life in the form of water to the same hands who would sever it from you. for you are the rose of Ali and Fatima he who gave his fragrance even to the hands who crushed it'.

Photo by Saarah Bokhari on August 06, 2022. May be an image of text that says 'REFUGE Oh, glorious ship who carries safely the drowning souls; abandoned within the wretchedness of the waves of the world, carry me to the of my Lord's refuge. province'.

Photo by Saarah Bokhari on August 06, 2022. May be an image of text that says 'OCEANIC Here, streams of distinct ages, nationalities and races merge themselves into this sea of lovers, where each concurrently lose their sense of identity, as they navigate only in the direction commanded by Hussain.'.

Photo by Saarah Bokhari on August 06, 2022. May be an image of text that says 'INFINITE You are a fountain, which gushes relentlessly, satiating the desire of my onging and i'm in love with a timeless love for which words will never have a name.'.
Photo by Saarah Bokhari on August 06, 2022. May be an image of 1 person and text.

node.text: I‚Äôll never forget this night. Peace be upon the Messenger‚Äôs blood that flowed endlessly.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Saarah Bokhari on August 06, 2022. May be an image of 1 person and text.

Photo by Saarah Bokhari on August 06, 2022. May be an image of text that says 'One year, after hazrat Qasim's majlis, I prayed to God sincerely. said Allah on this night, I always feel confused. Incredibly confused, about how it was even possible for a child of that age to go onto a battlefield, to be shown no mercy, and murdered in that way. How did he fit on the horse, how did he wear that armour? I asked Allah, please help me to understand, it confuses me so much that in masa' I can't even fathom the tragedy.'.
Photo by Saarah Bokhari on August 06, 2022. May be a black-and-white image of text.
Photo by Saarah Bokhari on August 06, 2022. May be an image of text.
Photo by Saarah Bokhari on August 06, 2022. May be an image of text.

Photo by Saarah Bokhari on August 06, 2022. May be an image of text that says 'I looked to God and said, ya Qasim... Allah, won't ask again. My heart was in pieces. I went home and I couldn't shake it off. Perhaps now could try to understand even the smallest percentile of the cruelty of what happened on that day Œ§Œø reflect upon how an Islam without humanity is no Islam at all.'.

Photo by Saarah Bokhari on August 05, 2022. May be an image of text that says 'BELOVED When the best of creation declared his love for you to the world, who am who am i to keep my love for you silent, beloved? when he shed holy tears for you, who am i to keep my eyes dry for you, beloved? when he kissed the places of your wounds years before they even arose, not to kiss the traces, that mark your calamity years after you, beloved? when you are the beloved of the beloved of god, who am 1 not to honour his love for you, beloved?'.

node.text:
beloved, sweet messenger (s). i‚Äôve been thinking about you. really thinking about you. the way you graced this world with your love, your natural propensity to it. the way you loved all, even when it hurt. the ecstasy of it. the way you caressed those most in need. the gentleness of it. and your smile. your beautiful, radiant, sweet smile. 

but how is it, ya rasoolallah, that you called yourself the father of a nation, that would kill your own child? 

your only lineage, your flesh, your blood. your eyes. your beautiful smile. your beautiful self. you. how is it you are the father of a nation, that would in essence kill you? how is it that you lived with that knowledge and still loved? how is it that you knew, and still gave? how is it, that when you forgave abu sufyan and the idolators of mecca, you knew it was his grandchild who would murder yours in karbala? how is it, that you still forgave the disbelief that turned into hypocrisy through its generations? those who generationally became the internal plague of your beautiful message. still you loved. 

how is it you raised a Hussain that would untie the hands of a prisoner Shimr, even when he knew this would be the man who would murder him brutally, sat on his chest? is this not rahmatul-lil-alameen? the mercy upon the worlds. the family of the light upon light. 

it‚Äôs because your beautiful and patient heart knew, we‚Äôd need this truth.. to recognise there‚Äôs the propensity to be a yazeedi or a Hussaini in each of us. to free us. and in the way you put us first, knowing you‚Äôd lose everything, even in death.. it‚Äôs for us to put you first in life, knowing there‚Äôs only everything to gain. 

i‚Äôm always at a loss of words, üò•üñ§ recalling karbala hurts, stings. it breaks you. over and over again. because you know the beauty of the soul they intended to assassinate. your love is endless, ya rasoolallah. but on the day of Ashura, so was the cruelty.

// poem from ‚ÄúArbaeen: A Lens into a Sacred Journey.‚Äù üñä 

#jummah #muharram

‚ÄúRather in this army of ours, even those people were also present who are still in the loins of men and wombs of women. Shortly, time will bring them out and faith will get strength through them.‚Äù ‚Äî Imam Ali (a) 

May Allah grant us the strength to be victorious in our faith battles, to present as true lovers, and to align to both the journey and destination of Imam Hussain (a). üñ§
